result.execSummary:
The defendant Peter J Cychosz was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Trespass to Dwelling, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.14.
  • Criminal Damage to Property, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Court orders restitution to be paid no later than close of business today.
Restitution Ordered for S.S.
Maintain fulltime employment/schooling/combination of the 2 or if not, perform 10 hours of community service per week.

Absolute sobriety.
No contact with S.S.

Assessment/treatment/counseling as deemed appropriate by the department.  Court notes it seems continuing treatment with VA program would be best.  
Court finds defendant is entitled to 1 day jail credit if revoked. 

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been faxed to the probation office.

records.addlTxt: on Petition for Early Discharge from Pobation 973.09(3)(d) - Petition is granted
for Early Discharge from Probation 973.09(3)(d
w/Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

Clerk Marisa.
Case Called: 11:14 am 
State appears by ADA Chad Minder; Def appears in person with Atty James Connell.  
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed. VRCW. 

State moves to: 
Ct. 1 (Burglary - Building or Dwelling)>>AMEND to Criminal Trespass to Dwelling pursuant to 943.14. 
Ct. 2 (Theft)>>D&RI. 
COURT grants above. 

PLEA: 
Amended Ct. 1 (Criminal Trespass to Dwelling)>>NO CONTEST. 
Ct. 3 (Criminal Damage to Property)>>NO CONTEST. 

COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, a factual basis, & def guilty. 
State notes def is to pay restitution immediately following court today. Atty Connell makes statement. 

COURT ORDERS: SWH for 2 years probation - CONDITIONS: AODA; assessment/treatment/counseling as deemed appropriate by the dept - court notes it seems continuing treatment with VA program would be best; absolute sobriety; no contact with S.S.; maintain fulltime employment/schooling/combination of the 2 or if not, perform 10 hours of community service per week; payment of court costs. 
COURT orders restitution to be paid no later than close of business today. 
COURT finds the def is entitled to 1 day jail credit if revoked. 

Adj: 11:30 am
Plea/sentencing hearing on December 17, 2014 at 11:15 am.
and Certificate of Appearance (subpoena mailed to S.L.S. 11/6/2014)

Clerk Marisa.

records.addlTxt: Shall not consume alcohol.  No contact with victim(s): S.S.    Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney.  No bars, taverns, liquor stores or beer tents.
